discussion_comments.comment_body: Instead of the string replacement logic here, can we update the template at `packages/node/src/generators/application/files/common/webpack.config.js__tmpl__`? If debug requires sourcemaps, maybe it should just be `sourceMaps: true` regardless of `NODE_ENV`.
Let's only warn once maybe during nx-release rather than once for every single project.

After the workspace module is copied, there needs to be something outside of the this executor to make sure they are transpiled, right? If the source is `.ts`, then it either needs `ts-node`/`tsx`/etc. to transpile it at runtime, or preferably the build step would do this, like esbuild does.

Yes. It's a separate challenge I think. 
If `copy-workspace-modules` is set to depend on `build` and `build` depends on `^build` then we can safely assume that buildable workspace libraries will be transpiled when they're copied across.

The challenge comes with non buildable workspace libraries. I think it requires more thought and not necessarily within the scope of this executor in particular.
